greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A minimal 2 X 2 subdeterminant array.
comment: Given that row 1 and column 1 are the sequence (1,2,3,4,...), T is the array of minimal positive subdeterminants in the sense that for each 2 X 2 submatrix
d is the least integer for which the resulting
determinant is positive; indeed, the determinant is 1.
When T is written as the triangle
the row sums are A006527 and the alternating row sums are 1,0,1,0,1,0,1,0,... (A059841).
The underlying function T is the same as in A244418, but this triangle's rows hold n+k constant, while in A244418, n is held constant on each row, and k <= n.
T(n,k) can be interpreted as a figurate number, with an (n-1) x (k-1) rectangle of dots interleaved with an n x k rectangle. The American flag illustrates T(5,6).
example: T(2,2)=5 because 5 is the least positive integer x for which the determinant of the 2 X 2 matrix below is positive:
mathematica: Grid[Table[SeriesCoefficient[Series[(n + (n - 1)*x)/(1 - x)^2, {x, 0, 12}], k], {n, 12}, {k, 0, 12}]] (* _L. Edson Jeffery_, Aug 23 2014 *)
Grid[Table[SeriesCoefficient[Series[(n - k + (n - k - 1)*x)/(1 - x)^2, {x, 0, 12}], k], {n, 12}, {k, 0, n - 1}]] (* _L. Edson Jeffery_, Aug 23 2014 *)
xref: Cf. A244418 (different triangle for the same function T).
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 09 2007
ext: Connection to A244418 and interpretation as figurate numbers from _Allan C. Wechsler_, Nov 18 2018
